Package software.leonov.common.io

Class CharStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.common.io.CharStream
  • public final class CharStream
extends Object
    Static utility methods for working with character streams.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    CharStreams

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static BufferedReader newBufferedReader​(InputStream in)
      Returns a new BufferedReader which reads from the given input stream in an efficient manner using the UTF-8 charset.

      Returns a new BufferedReader which reads from the given input stream in an efficient manner using the specified charset.

      Writes a character sequence to the given Appendable target.
      static OutputStream write​(Iterable<? extends CharSequence> lines, OutputStream out)
      Writes lines of text to the given output stream (with each line, including the last, terminated with the operating system's default line separator) using the UTF-8 charset.

      Writes lines of text to the given output stream (with each line, including the last, terminated with the operating system's default line separator) using the specified charset.

      Writes lines of text to the given Appendable target (with each line, including the last, terminated with the operating system's default line separator).

      Writes lines of text to the given output stream (with each line, including the last, terminated with the operating system's default line separator) using the UTF-8 charset.

      • read

        public static String read​(InputStream in)
                   throws IOException
        Returns a string of all the characters read from the given input stream using the UTF-8 charset.

        Does not close the input stream.

        Guava equivalent: CharStreams.toString(new InputStreamReader(InputStream, UTF_8))

        Parameters:
        in - the given input stream
        Returns:
        a string of all the characters read from the given input stream using the UTF-8 charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        CharStreams.toString(Readable)

      • read

        public static String read​(InputStream in,
                          Charset charset)
                   throws IOException
        Returns a string of all the characters read from the given input stream using the specified charset.

        Does not close the input stream.

        Guava equivalent: CharStreams.toString(new InputStreamReader(InputStream, Charset))

        Parameters:
        in - the given input stream
        charset - the character set to use when reading the input stream
        Returns:
        a string of all the characters read from the given input stream using the specified charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        CharStreams.toString(Readable)

      • readLines

        public static List<String> readLines​(InputStream in)
                              throws IOException
        Returns all the lines read from the given input stream using the UTF-8 charset. The lines do not include line-termination characters, but do include other leading and trailing whitespace.

        Does not close the input stream.

        Guava equivalent: CharStreams.readLines(new InputStreamReader(InputStream, UTF_8))

        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to read from
        Returns:
        a mutable List containing all the lines read from the given input stream using the UTF-8 charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        CharStreams.readLines(Readable)

      • readLines

        public static List<String> readLines​(InputStream in,
                                     Charset charset)
                              throws IOException
        Returns all the lines read from the given input stream using the specified charset. The lines do not include line-termination characters, but do include other leading and trailing whitespace.

        Does not close the input stream.

        Guava equivalent: CharStreams.readLines(new InputStreamReader(InputStream, Charset))

        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to read from
        charset - the character set to use
        Returns:
        a mutable List containing all the lines read from the given input stream using the specified charset
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        CharStreams.readLines(Readable)

      • write

        public static Appendable write​(CharSequence chars,
                               Appendable out)
                        throws IOException
        Writes a character sequence to the given Appendable target.

        Does not attempt close the target even if it is Closeable.

        Parameters:
        chars - the character sequence to write
        out - the given OutputStream
        Returns:
        the given Appendable target
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        public static OutputStream write​(CharSequence chars,
                                 OutputStream out)
                          throws IOException
        Writes a character sequence to the given output stream using the UTF-8 charset.

        Does not close the stream.

        Parameters:
        chars - the character sequence to write
        out - the given OutputStream
        Returns:
        the given OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        public static OutputStream write​(CharSequence chars,
                                 OutputStream out,
                                 Charset charset)
                          throws IOException
        Writes a character sequence to the given output stream using the specified charset.

        Does not close the stream.

        Parameters:
        chars - the character sequence to write
        out - the given OutputStream
        charset - the character set to use when writing the chars
        Returns:
        the given OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        public static Appendable write​(Iterable<? extends CharSequence> lines,
                               Appendable out)
                        throws IOException
        Writes lines of text to the given Appendable target (with each line, including the last, terminated with the operating system's default line separator).

        Does not attempt close the target even if it is Closeable.

        Parameters:
        lines - the lines of text to be written to the output stream
        out - the given Appendable target
        Returns:
        the given Appendable target
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • write

        public static OutputStream write​(Iterable<? extends CharSequence> lines,
                                 OutputStream out)
                          throws IOException
        Writes lines of text to the given output stream (with each line, including the last, terminated with the operating system's default line separator) using the UTF-8 charset.

        Does not close the stream.

        Parameters:
        lines - the lines of text to be written to the output stream
        out - the given OutputStream
        Returns:
        the given OutputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
